title: In Bounds
description: A Skater is $in bounds:in-bounds$ if the only points at which they are touching the floor are on or in between the track boundary lines. Once touching beyond the track boundary, a Skater is considered to be $in bounds:in-bounds$ again once all parts of the Skater that are touching the floor are on or between the track boundary lines. A Skater who touches the floor beyond the track boundary with only one arm or hand is still considered $in bounds:in-bounds$ (see also $out of bounds:out-of-bounds$, $straddling:straddling$).
